cleaned_text: Baby Cough Syrup + Immune with Honey, Natural Cherry Natural Cherry2.0FL OZ How would you like to receive this item ? Description Zarbee's Complete Baby Cough Syrup + Immune with Honey is safe & effective for babies 12 months to 24 months. Our baby cough syrup is made with a special blend of dark honey to soothe coughs associated with hoarseness, dry throat, & irritants* and zinc to support the immune system*. This natural cherry flavor cough syrup is made without drugs, alcohol, artificial sweeteners, artificial flavors, dyes, or gluten. Zarbee's is the #1 Pediatrician Recommended Cough Syrup Brand for Babies & Kids 12 & under. Keep your hive healthy: Check out our complete range of products that are made from carefully selected ingredients inspired by nature and backed by science. *These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Made in United States Soothes coughs associated with hoarseness, dry throat and irritants.* Occasional coughs* Irritated throats* Hoarseness* Under 12 months: Not recommended 12 months to 24 months: 3 milliliters Shake well before using. Take only as directed. Take as needed, not to exceed 4 times per day. For occasional use. Talk with your doctor before use if your child is taking medicine or is under a doctor's care for a medical condition.©Zarbees, Inc. [Show More](javascript:void(0)) Product Specifications IngredientsWater, Natural Flavor, Citric Acid Nutrition FactsServing Size 3 mLServings Per Container About 19 Nutritional Information % Daily Value Total Carbohydrate 3g 2% Calories 15 Total Sugars 3g Includes Added Sugars 3g Zinc (as Zinc Gluconate) 0.75mg Proprietary Blend of Dark Honey 4g Warnings Reclose cap tightly after each use If condition persists or worsens, stop use and consult a doctor. Do not use if your child is allergic to any of the ingredients. Do not exceed recommended serving. KEEP OUT OF REACH OF CHILDREN WARNING: This product contains honey and as such it should not be used by children under 12 months of age.
